--- createdAt: 2026-01-21 updatedAt: 2026-01-21 title: useIntlayer Hook Documentation | solid-intlayer description: See how to use the useIntlayer hook for solid-intlayer package keywords: - useIntlayer - dictionary - Intlayer - intlayer - Internationalization - Documentation - Solid - Solid.js slugs: - doc - packages - solid-intlayer - useIntlayer history: - version: 8.0.0 date: 2026-01-21 changes: Unified documentation for all exports --- # useIntlayer Hook Documentation The `useIntlayer` hook allows you to retrieve localized content from a dictionary using its key. In Solid, this hook returns a reactive **accessor** function that updates whenever the locale changes. ## Usage ```tsx import { useIntlayer } from "solid-intlayer"; const MyComponent = () => { const content = useIntlayer("my_dictionary_key"); return (

{content().title}

{content().description}

); }; ``` ## Description The hook performing the following tasks: 1. **Locale Detection**: It uses the current locale from the `IntlayerProvider` context. 2. **Dictionary Injection**: it automatically injects the content of the dictionary corresponding to the provided key, using the optimized declarations generated by the Intlayer compiler. 3. **Reactivity**: It returns a Solid accessor (`Accessor`) that automatically re-evaluates when the global locale state changes. 4. **Translation Processing**: it resolves the content based on the detected locale, processing any `t()`, `enu()`, etc., definitions found within the dictionary. ## Parameters - **key**: The unique key of the dictionary (as defined in your content declaration files). - **locale** (optional): Override the current locale. ## Returns An accessor function (`() => Content`) that returns the localized content.
